blister blight.fertilizer: 10-10-10 NPK fertilizer, 100 g per plant every 6–8 weeks
blister blight.water: Avoid waterlogging; irrigate early morning, ~60 % field capacity
blister blight.prevention: Ensure good air flow, shade management, prune dense growth, discard infected litter

grey leaf.fertilizer: Apply 100 g 16-16-16 NPK per bush every 8 weeks
grey leaf.water: Maintain ~65 % soil moisture, avoid evening watering
organic_medicine: Neem cake 250 g per plant at planting
grey leaf.prevention: Improve drainage, remove diseased leaves, maintain plucking standards

brown blight.fertilizer: Single super phosphate 200 g per plant annually
brown blight.water: Keep soil slightly dry (~55 %), avoid leaf wetting
brown blight.prevention: Sanitize field, prune lower branches, avoid spray drift

bird eye spot.fertilizer: Balanced NPK (10-10-10), 100 g per plant every 6 weeks
bird eye spot.water: Sprinkle early morning; avoid standing water
bird eye spot.prevention: Provide spacing, mulch fallen leaves, ensure sunlight penetration

shot hole.fertilizer: Potassium sulfate 100 g per plant quarterly
shot hole.water: Maintain ~60 % soil moisture; avoid foliage wetness
shot hole.prevention: Clean fallen debris, prune infected twigs, improve airflow

Anthracnose.fertilizer: Biofertilizer with P-solubilizers, e.g. phosphate-solubilizing bacteria
Anthracnose.water: Keep root zone moist (~65 %), avoid foliage irrigation
Anthracnose.prevention: Avoid overcrowding, disinfect tools after pruning

Grey Leaf Spot.fertilizer: Apply potash (K2O) 50 g per plant every 2 months
Grey Leaf Spot.water: Keep foliage dry—water at soil level in morning
organic_medicine: Baking soda (1 tsp per L) foliar spray
Grey Leaf Spot.prevention: Remove weed hosts, ensure air circulation, avoid splash irrigation

white spot.fertilizer: Potassium nitrate 1 g per L foliar feed monthly
white spot.water: Spray early morning; avoid humid microclimate
white spot.prevention: Avoid overhead irrigation, prune dense canopy, sanitize tools

black leaf spot.fertilizer: Urea 50 g per plant monthly to boost nitrogen
black leaf spot.water: Maintain soil moisture ~60 %, avoid wet foliage
black leaf spot.prevention: Remove lower infected leaves, improve field hygiene

downy mildew.fertilizer: Bone meal 100 g per plant for phosphorus
downy mildew.prevention: Reduce humidity, space plants, remove infected tissues

powdery mildew.fertilizer: Apply 10-10-10 NPK 100 g per plant monthly
powdery mildew.water: Avoid heavy nitrogen; irrigate soil only
powdery mildew.prevention: Improve airflow, avoid excess nitrogen, prune shady branches

sooty mold.water: Mild irrigation; wash leaves to remove honeydew
sooty mold.prevention: Control pests (aphids, mealybugs), clean foliage regularly

Cercospora Leaf.water: Moderate soil moisture (~65 %), avoid foliage wetness
Cercospora Leaf.prevention: Remove infected leaves, improve air flow, avoid splash irrigation

Helminthosporium Leaf.prevention: Ensure good drainage; space plants well

Red leaf spot.prevention: Prune and sun-dry infected branches, reduce shade

algal leaf.prevention: Improve sunlight penetration, remove algae-covered leaves

Bacterial Leaf blight.fertilizer: Low nitrogen; apply potassium sulfate 100 g/plant
Bacterial Leaf blight.water: Keep dry; irrigate early and avoid splash
Bacterial Leaf blight.prevention: Use clean planting material, sanitize pruning shears

Mosaic Virus.fertilizer: Balanced NPK with micronutrient chelate–monthly soil application
medicine: No direct treatment; control insect vectors (aphids)
organic_medicine: Neem oil with pyrethrin for vector control
Mosaic Virus.prevention: Use virus‐free materials, row separation, regular vector scouting

Yellowing Chlorosis.fertilizer: Apply chelated iron (Fe-EDDHA) 100 g/plant, magnesium sulfate 50 g
Yellowing Chlorosis.water: Ensure irrigation to avoid drought before chlorosis onset
Yellowing Chlorosis.prevention: Balance soil pH (6–6.5), test for micronutrient deficiencies

healthy.water: Maintain ~65 % soil moisture via drip irrigation
healthy.prevention: Routine pruning, field sanitation, integrated pest management (IPM)
